issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:

fields.summary: Volume attachment failure while using SAN (EMC/Netapp)
fields.environment:
storage-backend: emc-vnx

More info from this NC (related to /dev/sdc)...

{code}
[root@g-26-08 eucalyptus]# ll /dev/sd*
brw-rw---- 1 root       disk 8,  0 Apr 15 07:47 /dev/sda
brw-rw---- 1 root       disk 8,  1 Apr 15 04:48 /dev/sda1

[root@g-26-08 eucalyptus]# virsh list

----------------------------------------------------
 39    i-929217bb                     running

[root@g-15-03 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-929217bb   
RESERVATION	r-f63c88b6	956279167330	euca-internal-imaging-worker-01
INSTANCE	i-929217bb	emi-931a0924	euca-10-111-31-101.eucalyptus.g-15-03.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-31-183.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-04-16T11:48:22.310Z	one				monitoring-enabled	10.111.31.101	10.111.31.183			instance-store					hvm		4debf4e8-196d-4b51-a0db-3b8364d8beac_one_1	sg-5324271a			arn:aws:iam::956279167330:instance-profile/internal/imaging/imaging-worker-01	x86_64

{code}

This looks like it could be a network hiccup or something similar on the device end. We haven't made any changes in the perl scripts in 4.1.1. I'll check the SAN logs tomorrow and see if there is a cleanup needed etc.

This issue was also seen in a test that is using Netapp:
